body_html:
I've got the same problem, freezes after exactly one epoch, but not really reproducible for smaller datasets. I'm using CUDA 9.1, Pytorch 0.3.1, Python 3.6 in a Docker environment.
I tried @jph00 's Dataloader, however I found it was a lot slower for my usecase. My workaround currently is to recreate the Pytorch DataLoader before every epoch. This seems to work, but is really ugly.

I tried @jph00 's Dataloader, however I found it was a lot slower for my usecase. My workaround currently is to recreate the Pytorch DataLoader before every epoch. This seems to work, but is really ugly.
body:
I've got the same problem, freezes after exactly one epoch, but not really reproducible for smaller datasets. I'm using CUDA 9.1, Pytorch 0.3.1, Python 3.6 in a Docker environment. 
I tried @jph00 's Dataloader, however I found it was a lot slower for my usecase. My workaround currently is to recreate the Pytorch DataLoader before every epoch. This seems to work, but is really ugly.
